page.title: 16Fitzpatrick Riding Stable
page.content: The riding school began in 1974. They have 27{horses & ponies.}The riding instructors teach the children to ride ponies.The children have to wear a hat for protection.They wear boots as well.They start to teach children to ride at five years old.The horses have to wear a saddle,a bridle and a bit. People come to ride from 25 miles around.Disabled children ride twice a week.Adults also come to ride.The stables are cleaned out every day.The horses are groomed every time they go out.The tack is cleaned twice a week. In winter the horses eat{hay and {barley}which is ground,boiled and mixed with beet pulp,linseed oil(to keep their coats shiny)and shredded carrots.They sleep in the stables.In summer they eat grass in the fields and sleep there too.
